gr.aueb.databasics

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • gr.aueb.databasics.Table

  • public class Table
extends Object
    Table is the class that allows the creation and editing of tables inside a database. A Table object is practically a series of Attribute (might also be referred to as "column") objects held inside an ArrayList of type Attribute and encapsulates the basic information needed for this purpose:
    • The table's name
    • The number of attributes that the table holds
    • The Attribute objects which contain the content the user inputs

    The class is designed in such manner that it will support methods inside of it and other classes externally to execute the usual functions that a database has, such as:

    • View Table's content
    • View columns' content
    • Input data into a table
    • Copy an entry to another position of the same or another table
    • Move an entry to another position of the same or another table
    • Copy a single field to another position of the same or another table
    • Move a single field to another position of the same or another table
    • Delete a table
    • Delete an entry
    • Erase a field
    • Change a field
    • Change an entry
    • More

    An important point to consider is that the methods inside the class are written in such a manner that they require the data input given in a strict way by the user.

    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    George Bakalis, Andreas Vlachos, Artemis Doumeni, Evi Vratsanou, Kostas Kyriakidis, Martha Pontika

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(String name)
        A simple constructor that only expects a name to initialize a table
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be used as a title for the table

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        public boolean exists(String name)

      • checkEntryType

        public boolean checkEntryType(String[] entries)
        This method implements a check on each element of an entry line by utilizing method Attribute.checkType(String)
        Parameters:
        entries - An array of String elements that represents an entry line,
        Returns:
        Returns true if all elements match the corresponding types and false if at least one does not.

      • checkEntry

        public boolean checkEntry(String[] entries)
        This method checks whether a set of values matches with the length and the types of the table it is called upon. The types check is implemented via the method checkEntryType(String[])
        Parameters:
        entries - An array of String elements, each one of the representing an element of the table's new line, excluding the default attributes' values.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the set of values matches with the length and the types of the table, false if not.

      • newEntryMenu

        public static void newEntryMenu(Table table,
                                String entry)
        This method creates an entry. It asks for the entry, splits it on commas and holds it inside an array. Checks whether the input is valid using checkEntry(String[]) and then proceeds to pass the correct input inside the table.
        Parameters:
        table - The Table object in which the new entry will be created
        entry - The String that contains the fields, separated by commas

      • newEntry

        public void newEntry(String[] entries)
        This method inserts a line of values in the table it is called upon and initializes the Last Modified column of the line.
        Parameters:
        entries - An array of String elements, each one of the representing an element of the table's new line, excluding the default attributes' values.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)

      • getLines

        public int getLines()

      • checkInput

        public static boolean checkInput(int choice,
                                 boolean correctEntry)
        This method implements a simple check on the entry that the user has given on demand, in order to decide if it is an integer between 1 and 6, as the choices indicate. It uses a custom exception to guide the user into a correct entry, if needed.
        Parameters:
        choice - int containing the user's choice
        correctEntry - a boolean initialized as true, prone to switching to false if there's a wrong input
        Returns:
        true if no mistake was found; false if there's a wrong input.

      • newAttribute

        public void newAttribute(String name,
                         int choice)
        This method creates an attribute (column) using a name and an integer which corresponds to the data type the attribute will hold
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Attribute object to be created
        choice - An int which represents the data type of the Attribute to be created

      • searchAttribute

        public int searchAttribute(String attName)
        This method finds the position of an attribute specified by the user in a table.
        Parameters:
        attName - An String element, containing the name of the attribute which position must be found.
        Returns:
        An int element, containing the position of this attribute in the table

      • viewLines

        public void viewLines(ArrayList<Integer> entryPositions)
        This method presents a set of given lines of the table upon which it is called.
        Parameters:
        entryPositions - An ArrayList of Integer elements, each one representing the position of a line in the attribute arraylists.

      • view

        public void view()
        When view() is called on a Table object, it views the table in a structured manner

      • viewAttribute

        public void viewAttribute(ArrayList<String> attributeNames)
        When it is called on a Table object, it views the specified attributes of the table in a structured manner
        Parameters:
        attributeNames - Contains the names of the attributes to be viewed

      • attPositions

        public ArrayList<Integer> attPositions(ArrayList<String> atts)
        Gives the positions of the specified attributes inside a table
        Parameters:
        atts - Contains the names of the attributes
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of integers corresponding to the attributes' positions

      • search

        public ArrayList<Integer> search(ArrayList<String> attributeNames,
                                 ArrayList<String> elements)
        This method searches for lines which contain a set of elements specified by the user and returns their positions. The search can be parameterized by one or more attributes. There is a 1-1 relation between the values and the attributes given for search.
        Parameters:
        attributeNames - An arraylist of String elements, containing the names of the attributes which will be searched for the corresponding elements.
        elements - An arraylist of String elements, containing the values that will be searched in the attribute of the corresponding position of the attributeNames arraylist.
        Returns:
        An arrraylist of Integer elements, containing the positions of the lines that match the search criteria.

      • sortTable

        public ArrayList<gr.aueb.databasics.Attribute> sortTable(String keyAttribute,
                                                         int choice)
                                                  throws ParseException
        Check if the column can be sorted and if yes call the appropriate method.
        Parameters:
        keyAttribute - A String holding the name of the Attribute to be used to sort the table
        choice - 1 represents ascending order, -1 represents descending order
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Attribute objects. It is the sorted table.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if parsing fails

      • returnFormatter

        public SimpleDateFormat returnFormatter(int index)
        Return the appropriate date format (simple date or time stamp).
        Parameters:
        index - Checks if the attribute refers to the Last Modified column
        Returns:
        Returns the date format

      • delete

        public void delete()
        This method deletes a whole table specified by the user and sets the table's content to "null" after delete.

      • deleteAttribute

        public void deleteAttribute(String att)
        This method deletes an attribute specified by the user and reduces the table's number of attributes after deleting the specified attribute. The delete is parameterized by the name of the attribute the user wants to delete.
        Parameters:
        att - An String element, containing the name of the attribute which will be deleted.

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry(int linePosition)
        This method deletes a whole entry specified by the user and reduces the table's number of lines after deleting the specified entry. The delete is parameterized by the number that indicates the position of the entry the user wants to delete.
        Parameters:
        linePosition - Contains the number that indicates the position of entry which will be deleted.

      • deleteElement

        public void deleteElement(int lineNumber,
                          String attributeName)
        This method deletes an element specified by the user and sets the element's content to "--" after deleting the specified element. The delete is parameterized by the number that indicates the elelement's line position and the the element's name of attribute the user wants to delete.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - Contains the number that indicates the line of the element which will be deleted.
        attributeName - Contains the name of the element's attribute which will be deleted.

      • dataChange

        public ArrayList<String> dataChange(int num,
                                    ArrayList<String> attNames,
                                    ArrayList<String> newValues)
        This method changes data which belong to one or more attributes and in one specific line using the method Attribute.changeField(int, String) and it gives the opportunity of multiple elements change with one run.
        Parameters:
        num - An int which contains the line number of the data to be changed.
        attNames - An arraylist of String elements, containing the names of the attributes where the data to be changed belong to.
        newValues - An arraylist of String elements, containing the new values of the data to be changed.
        Returns:
        An arrraylist of String elements, containing the changed values.

      • saveTable

        public void saveTable(String databasePath)
        This method saves the contents of a Table in the format of a csv file in a default location. The default attribute representing the line number is not saved in the file. The name and the first line of the file represent the name of the table. The second line of the file contains the types of the attributes, separated by commas. The third line of the file contains the names of the attributes, separated by commas. Each of the following lines contains the elements of a table line, separated by commas.
        Parameters:
        databasePath - A String representing the path of the database directory in which the table will be saved
